intro: Stenogyne alternans, commonly known as the Hawaiian honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in coastal and lowland forests. Stenogyne alternans plays an important ecological role in supporting pollinators and maintaining native plant communities.
